title.narrative: Danish Refugee Council activities in Syria and the region, 2020

description.narrative: Danish Refugee Council activities in Syria and the region, 2020 Protecting the most vulnerable displacement and conflict affected Syrians through age, gender, and diversity responsive interventions.

While building on existing partnerships developed and nurtured in the ongoing Danida Extraordinary grant, the Danish Refugee Council (DRC) will also continue to seek new partnerships and enhance the capacity of civil society and state actors to provide support and promote human rights. The COVID-19 pandemic has heightened the need to build resilience of local actors to withstand shocks and deliver assistance, increasing sustainability of interventions and more broadly, the humanitarian response, by supporting local leadership and ownership of the response. DRC will invest in existing and new partners to deliver quality protection programming in alignment with country partnership strategies, informed by robust capacity assessment processes and capacity building plans that are developed in close consultation with partners, that incorporate technical mentorship, organizational capacity building on issues such as fundraising and financial management where needed, and financial and/or material support. Through partnerships, DRC paves the way to transfer capacities and expertise that will enable handover of implementation and service delivery and allows for smooth exit where appropriate.
